snippet: Seeley, who has served as an assistant United States attorney in Washington since 2006, inherits the unit that handled the Alex Rodriguez doping case.
abstract: Baseball Roundup; Major League Baseball appoints Bryan Seeley as its new head of investigations, latest step in an overhaul of the department since the Alex Rodriguez doping case; MLB scores noted.
lead_paragraph: Seeley, who has served as an assistant United States attorney in Washington since 2006, inherits the unit that handled the Alex Rodriguez doping case.

headline.main: M.L.B. Hires Bryan Seeley to Lead Investigations Unit
headline.print_headline: M.L.B. Hires Federal Prosecutor to Lead Investigations Unit
